name: FSMUIViewController
body:
FSMUIViewController is an UIViewController extended by Finite State Machine (FSM) functionality. It provides functionality to configure different states and then move between these states.
 
## Configuration of States

This section discusses how to configuration of custom view controller states and fixed view controller states.

Each fsm state definition consists of two different parts:
* The identifier of the fsm state, which is defined by an arbitrary string, e.g. "state1". There is also a default state.
* For each fsm state defined before, code to be executed in that state has to be assigned to some view controller state controlled by UIViewController.

The following view controller states are available:
* tDidInitViewState
* tDidLoadViewState
* tWillAppearViewState
* tDidAppearViewState
* tWillDisappearViewState
* tDidDisappearViewState
* tWillUnloadViewState
* tDidUnloadViewState

### Configure an arbitrary State

```
[[self configureState:@"state1"] onViewState:tDidAppearViewState do:^{
   ...do something
}];
```

### Configure the default State

```
[[self configureDefaultState] onViewState:tDidAppearViewState do:^{
   ...do something
}];
```

### Configure some States at once

This functionality allows for providing some code to be executed on a certain set of states.

```
[[self configureStates:@"state1", @"state2"] onViewState:tDidAppearViewState do:^{
   ...do something
}];
```

### Configure all States at once

This functionality allows for providing some code to be executed on each state.

```
[[self configureAllStates] onViewState:tDidAppearViewState do:^{
   ...do something
}];
```

## Transition IN/OUT of a state

If not explicitly provided, code is executed while transitioning into a certain state. It is possible to configure this behavior.

Available modes are:

* tIn
* tOut
* tInOut

### Transition IN a certain State

```
[[self configureState:@"state1" mode:tIn] onViewState:tDidAppearViewState do:^{
   ...do something
}];
```

### Transition OUT of a certain State

```
[[self configureState:@"state1" mode:tOut] onViewState:tDidAppearViewState do:^{
   ...do something
}];
```

### Transition IN and OUT of a certain State

```
[[self configureState:@"state1" mode:tInOut] onViewState:tDidAppearViewState do:^{
   ...do something
}];
```

## Transitioning between States

### Transition to a certain State

```
-(void)toState:(int)state;
```

Do nothing, if you are already in that state.

### Transition to the default State

```
-(void)toDefaultState;
```

Do nothing, if you are already in that state.

### Forced transition to a certain State

```
-(void)toStateForce:(int)state;
```

Do move, even if you are already in that state.

### Forced transition to the default State

```
-(void)toDefaultStateForce;
```

Do move, even if you are already in that state.
